Hi!

Instead of using Rules (or do I missunderstand something?), you could =
annotate the test-class MyTest with @Runwith(Parametrized.class) and then
a=
 public static method with @Parameters returning a List<Object[]>

In your =
case, create, maybe an ArrayList<Object[]>, to which you add for each row i=
n your csv file a new Object[]-instance (maybe containing 3 Integers). Then=
, you need a public contructor MyText(Integer a, Integer b, Integer c) whic=
h assigns the parameters to fields (aka the fixture). A (set of) methods an=
notated with @Test can then run tests for these values.

Each row in your c=
sv file will be run against each @Test-annotated method (failure or not occ=
uring).

Cheers,  Georg
